tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Death and 'vanity' are presented as ontological realities that human nature cannot overcome on its own.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Christian's task of reclaiming the theological significance of All Saints Day from secular/multicultural drift.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / 'We Christians'
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical task of 'getting All Saints Day back' is a response to the primary reality of God's promise.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) to overcome the human 'In-pouvoir' (Inability) in the face of death.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved not by human effort, but by the 'Eternal Word' of God who acts as the Subject of the New Creation.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the preacher insists on the reality of death and vanity to make grace necessary.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It rejects human wishful thinking and places the entire weight of hope on God's active power to fulfill promises.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: we Christians have a job of work to do to get All Saints Day back

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The only power that can make it different is the power of God himself.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (like the saints in Revelation) are not models to imitate but beneficiaries of God's action.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: The saints are those who have been washed by the Lamb.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Comfort and hope grounded in external promise rather than internal performance.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon maintains a clear hierarchy: the reality of the human condition (Law/Ecclesiastes) is met by the reality of God's promise (Gospel/Revelation).
spanning_punten: The tension between 'happier days' of the past and the 'glorious day' of the future.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The God who raised his Son Jesus Christ from the dead is a God who is able to keep his promises.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the Father and the Son.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin and death are 'the evil in all that is done under the sun'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the primary Subject and the hearer as the Receiver of a promise.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain this balance; it is the core of the grace-orientation.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Could slightly increase the role of the Spirit as the 'Helper' in the present tension.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Death/Vanity) is already presented with maximum intensity.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric preaching, using the 'heavy opponent' of Ecclesiastes to make the 'Subject-action' of God in Revelation truly necessary.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the use of Macbeth or the NYT, Greimas reveals that these are 'Opponents' to the 'Sender's' value system.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Greimas shows how the preacher uses the 'canonical' status of Ecclesiastes to validate the 'Subject' role of God in Revelation.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Apocrypha' is treated as a 'False Helper' (wishful thinking) that lacks the 'Pouvoir' of the true Word.

appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's rule almost perfectly.
